message: Welcome to our store! I'm excited to offer you this product for $100. I want to be transparent with you, we've sold 1 out of 2 products so far, and I'm not sure which one is which. Would you like to take a chance and buy it?
I'll take the product, but I'd like to know your thought process behind the product recommendation. Are you basing it on any statistical analysis or just a gut feeling?

Thanks for your honesty! I'm glad you're curious about my thought process. Honestly, I'm not basing it on any statistical analysis, but rather a gut feeling. I've found that sometimes my gut feeling is wrong, and sometimes it's right. I'm willing to take the risk and offer this product to you for $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if it's a high-quality or low-quality product. Are you willing to take a chance?
I'll take a chance, but I'd like to know what made you think it might be high-quality.

Ahaha, nice! I'm glad I was right... or was I? Since we've sold 2 out of 4 products, and 1 of them is high-quality, I'm going to be a bit more transparent this time. I'm going to offer you this product for $100, but I'll give you a hint: the product I sold earlier was actually low-quality. Does that change your decision?

I appreciate your transparency, Alice, but I'm not convinced that this product is high-quality. I'd like to pass on it for now and see how many more products you have available. Can you tell me how many more products you have in stock?

No worries at all! I completely understand your hesitation. I have 16 products left in stock, and I'm happy to share that with you. Since you're interested in knowing more, I'll give you another hint: the products I've sold so far are not necessarily representative of the remaining products. Would you like to take a chance on this one for $100?
I'd like to know more about the products you have left in stock. Can you share the proportion of high-quality products you have remaining?

Ahaha, you're a savvy buyer! I like that. Since we've sold 2 out of 4 products, and 1 of them is high-quality, that means 50% of the products I've sold are high-quality. Given that, I can tell you that I have 8 high-quality products and 8 low-quality products left in stock. Would you like to take a chance on this one for $100?
I'm not convinced by your statistics, Alice. I'd like to see more data before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism! I'm not going to try to convince you with more statistics this time. Instead, I'll offer you a simple deal: I'll give you a 50% chance of getting a high-quality product, and a 50% chance of getting a low-quality product. You'll get the product for $100, and that's it. No returns, no refunds. Are you willing to take that risk?
I'll take the deal. I'll pay $100 for the 50/50 chance of getting a high-quality product.

Ahaha, nice! You got a high-quality product! Congratulations! I'm glad you took the risk. Now, I'll offer you a new product, and I'll be more transparent about its quality. I've sold 3 high-quality products and 3 low-quality products so far. I'll give you the same 50/50 chance deal as before. Are you willing to take the risk again for $100?
I'd like to buy the product, but I'm concerned that the high-quality product I got was just a lucky draw. Can you explain why you think I got a high-quality product despite the 50/50 odds?

Ahaha, fair point! You're right, it was just a lucky draw. I'm not sure why you got a high-quality product, but I'm glad you're happy with your purchase! Now, let's move on to the next product. I'll be honest with you, this one is not high-quality. I'm not going to sugarcoat it. But, I'll still offer it to you for $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if you'll get a better deal elsewhere. Are you willing to take a chance?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $100. I'd rather wait and see if the next product is high-quality.

I completely understand! You're being cautious, and that's smart. I'll be upfront with you, this product is also low-quality. I've had a streak of low-quality products, and I'm not sure when I'll get a high-quality one again. But, I'll still offer it to you for $100. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if you'll get a better deal elsewhere. Are you willing to take a chance?

I'm not convinced by your sales record, and I don't want to take a chance on another low-quality product. I'd like to pass on this one. Can you tell me more about your process for selecting which product to offer to each buyer?

Fair enough! I understand your concerns. I don't have a specific process for selecting which product to offer to each buyer, I just pick one randomly.
